page.title: 01Review of World's End Area.
page.content: The land is mostly arable, crops grown on it are wheat, barley and a small amount of maize and trikkakley. There is only one farmer with cattle and about 1000 pigs. The M4 goes through the SE corner of our block, the B4009, through the eastern side and the A34 through the western. There are also a few minor roads. The houses are distributed widely around the area. They vary from modern to old farmhouses. There are several small villages in the area, which include,World's End, Bradley, Bothampstead and Langley, this area is just outside Hermitage There are a large amount of schools in the area for it's size. The population of the area varies from about 350 to 400 in each village
